keyPolicies.policyDescription: Setting up an item by item review of all expenditures and apply the axe to peripheral costs such as 'town twinning' schemes and excessive 'expenses' brochures.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Return Planning to local control and protect the Green Belt
keyPolicies.policyDescription: UKIP will return planning to genuine local control, commit to protecting the Green Belt by remoting appeal bodies, and aim to reduce housing development on protected land.
Promising a 5 year complete stop on immigration to alleviate undue strain on local infrastructure and services.
Encouraging the use of referendums to better reflect the wishes of local residents on crucial local issues.
Eliminating speed cameras that do not reduce accidents and introducing flashing warnings and speed bumps instead. Making parking control gentler, with more warnings and lower fines.
UKIP will not oblige the elderly to sell their homes to pay for residential home care.
Opposing incinerators mandated by the EU by finding recycling solutions suited to the UK thus avoiding EU landfill taxes.
UKIP plans to abolish the regional layer of local Government like in Guildford, returning powers to County and Borough councils.
Aiming to outlaw all forms of electronic snooping by local authorities.

issues.brexitEurope: Rejecting EU imposed incinerators to suit the recycling needs of Britain.
issues.environment: Protect the Green Belt and oppose development of habitable houses on protected land to manageable levels.
issues.governance: End unwanted Regional Government layers and restore powers to local councils. Promote referendums to reflect local wishes.
issues.immigration: A 5 year complete stop on immigration to reduce pressure on local services.
issues.socialWelfare: Care for the elderly by not obliging them to sell their homes for care.

housing.content: Return planning to local control and protect the Green Belt. Oppose development of habitable houses on protected land to reduce housing pressure to manageable levels.
